content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><modsCollection rowCount="1"><mods><identifier type="pw">fs20123143</identifier><identifier type="pwpk">70044079</identifier><identifier type="series">Fact Sheet</identifier><identifier type="seriesNumber">2012-3143</identifier><identifier type="seriesCode">FS</identifier><genre>USGS Numbered Series</genre><titleInfo><title>Assessment of coal geology, resources, and reserve base in the Powder River Basin, Wyoming and Montana</title></titleInfo><originInfo><dateOther>Tue, 26 Feb 2013 00:00 -0600</dateOther><dateIssued>2013</dateIssued><publisher>U.S. Geological Survey</publisher><placeTerm>Reston, VA</placeTerm></originInfo><name><namePart>Scott, David C.; Luppens, James A.</namePart><role>Author</role></name><abstract>Using a geology-based assessment methodology, the U.S. Geological Survey estimated in-place resources of 1.07 trillion short tons of coal in the Powder River Basin, Wyoming and Montana. Of that total, with a maximum stripping ratio of 10:1, recoverable coal was 162 billion tons. The estimate of economically recoverable resources was 25 billion tons.</abstract><physicalDescription><form>6 p.</form><form>U.S. Geological Survey</form><form>Reston, VA</form></physicalDescription><location><url note="DOCUMENT">http://pubs.usgs.gov/fs/2012/3143/fs-2012-3143.pdf</url><url note="INDEX PAGE">http://pubs.usgs.gov/fs/2012/3143/</url><url note="THUMBNAIL">http://pubs.er.usgs.gov/thumbnails/fs_2012_3143.gif</url></location><note type="citation/reference">Assessment of coal geology, resources, and reserve base in the Powder River Basin, Wyoming and Montana; 2013; FS; 2012-3143; Fact Sheet; Scott, David C.; Luppens, James A.</note><languageTerm>English</languageTerm><relatedItem type="original"><titleInfo><title>Fact Sheet</title></titleInfo></relatedItem></mods></modsCollection>
